definition: to be willing to/to be ready to/to be content with/accepting (of restriction, sacrifice, risk etc)
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
surname Yu
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
unwilling to accept/not content with (a subservient role, a mediocre result etc)

sentences.english: Is being secondary to Apple really that bad?
sentences.chinese: 甘于苹果之后难道就真的那么不好吗？

sentences.english: The levels of motivation and commitment that I have witnessed at the factory deserve the highest praise.
sentences.chinese: 你们的积极主动和甘于奉献的应该受到最高的赞扬。

sentences.english: Second, like it was stated before, you must take responsabilities and then assumed them.
sentences.chinese: 第二，像之前提到的，你必须甘于负责，并努力承担。

sentences.english: To the network " stockaded village advocate " for, impersonal person ready wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 对网络“寨主”来说，并非人人都甘于草莽。

definition: to be willing to/to resign oneself to
to feel contented with
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
willingly
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
mediocre/indifferent/commonplace
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to capitulate
mediocre
willingly and gladly (idiom)
obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to rely on others for the air one breathes (idiom); to depend on sb's whim for one's living
